website_summaries.verdict: Excellent quality masonry bits that last a long time and get the job done.
pros: Features seven bits with rock carbide tips in sizes ranging from 3/16" to 1/4'
Shanks have three flats so they don't slip out of your chuck
cons: A wider range of smaller bits would make this set even better

customer_reviews.title: Other bits have worked great - Quality Control issue This one bent on first use in concrete
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Dewalt fan. Have 5 different battery tools. Bought this set to work on new poured concrete wall basement. Had these six months and finally used this size drill. Seemed to struggle as if dull but then proceeded with average pressure to wobble then totally bend. May be a quality control issue since the other three I have used have performed as expected under far more stress. Will update if Dewalt responds or if the remaining bits also struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Set/Durable/Nice Holes.
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Only thing missing was the 1/8" I often use for a pilot hole. Worked great on freshly plastered lathe over plaster and cinder block walls. Still going strong after 50 some holes (use of anchors and screws with picture hangers and right angle hooks into anchors for hanging pots and pans etc.). Liked the variety and lengths as in some cases I needed the full length of the drill bit. Slow and steady and the holes were perfect. Nice snug fit for anchors. Wish they made the packaging friendlier for opening and reusing, but an Exacto worked fine to open for easier removal and storage. Must be an anti-theft thingy.
customer_reviews.author: Willowisp

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Used these with a hammer drill to drill through field-stone. Only needed to drill 8 holes, 2 inches deep. Burned through these bits on the first hole. Went to the hardware store and bought their store brand, one of their bits finished the rest of the holes. I thought the Dewalt brand meant quality... Not this time. Might be a knock off, I don't know, but I'll be avoiding Dewalt bits in the future, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Chunn

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have not had great success in using masonry drill bits. Most that I have bought have worn out very quickly. So, I purchased these with strong doubt that they would last. However, I am pleased to say that I was wrong. I have been very satisfied with the durability of these bits and would recommend them to anyone that has the need to drill into masonry.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie and Joie

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Used these bits in a standard drill (not a hammer drill) and they cut through brick mortar like butter. Not sure how they would fare with tougher materials but they met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Bits are great, case is junk.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a few of these for everything from reinforced concrete to stucco without issue. Like many products on the cheaper range they are fine for home use but probably fall short for any real heavy duty use. Only minor issue was the case they came in, not sure if they sat on a shelf for 5 years in the sun or something but the soft plastic case it about as brittle as Christmas ornament glass. Each time I pick up the package, half the bits fall out.
customer_reviews.author: R. Matteson

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet. I purchased this set to facilitate the installation of a shower slide bar in my bathroom. I needed to drill successfully through tile. 1 bit = 1 drill hole. Pathetic durability. Mark me a resounding NO.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: After fighting with drilling a hole in a concrete wall ...
customer_reviews.text: After fighting with drilling a hole in a concrete wall, I finally got these. I used a regular rotary drill and I had little trouble getting the hole drilled with these new bits.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with 6 bits only.  Wonder if even those are orginals.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived with only 6 bits. There was no 1/2 bit. The package was sealed (except for tear under 3/16'' bit), so where did that bit go? It looked like the package had been altered somehow. Makes me wonder if the 6 left are even original Dewalt bits. Returned it and did not get a replacement. Buying instead from a reputable brick-and-mortar store. Same price anyway.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Masonry Carbid drill bits, nice variety of sizes, 3/16 to 1/2 inch, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Dewalt masonry drill bits (Dewalt Rock Carbide 7 piece set) and they are going strong after several uses on hard masonry. I think they are a great value and go through masonry cleanly and work great. The selection of sizes for a 1/2 inch drill are really useful. Bits go from 3/16" to 1/2".
customer_reviews.author: knitter4years

customer_reviews.title: Package Fail
customer_reviews.text: This has some of the worst packaging I've ever seen. They expect you to cut it open, at which point the bits will just fall out when you least expect it. There is no way to re-close the package. I guarantee some outsourced DeWalt flunky forced the German factory to make it this way, otherwise it would have never left the country...
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: Best mason bit's i've used in a whilte
customer_reviews.text: I needed to pick up a new set of mason bit's due to losing them at job sites. I'm really happy with these, I've had some cheaper chinesium mason bits in the past that just chip and don't make clean accurate holes. Been really happy with these so far, holes are clean & chews through most masonry applications with ease. Pro's: Strong, clean holes, easy to drill Con's: None Yet
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW MUNKIE THE ONE REVIEW YOU NEED TO READ
customer_reviews.text: Masonry drill bits. I needed to put up some strong hooks into brick and was tired of making it work with the cheap kit drill bits that leave you hanging. These went through like a knife through butter I dropped to two stars on packaging as it would have been really nice to have had them in a plastic box and by opening the packaging you lose any potential to re use it to store them in.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: International Drill Bit
customer_reviews.text: One person commented about bits are made of Chinesium. I looked and the back and it says they were made in Germany imported to Mexico and distributed in the US. The package they are in is like trying to crack a safe.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected. Needed to drill 16 5/16’s holes to install concrete anchors into a concrete patio. Had zero issues drilling the holes and they were perfectly uniform.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Unger

customer_reviews.title: Work great for drilling into concrete & stucco
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these sooner instead of dulling a bunch of cheap bits and tiring out my arm drilling into stucco. They also work great with my hammer drill and can easily cut into concrete. To early to tell longevity but given the dewalt brand I have high hopes. Only reason I knocked off a star is the packaging should include a ziplock for resealing.
customer_reviews.author: Prime4Value

customer_reviews.title: Good drill bits
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a couple of projects mounting in brick and cinder block and they work great. Price was reasonable. Can't vouch for longevity because I have used them enough but I expect they will fine based on the company reputation and other reviews. Happy with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: There is no better steel (reasonably priced-wise) than German steel
customer_reviews.text: There is no better steel (reasonably priced-wise) than German steel, when it comes to drill bits. The bits bite first thing and don't walk around much using a REGULAR drill, but with a hammer drill (Non SDS application) these things will go through the hardest concrete like it's nothing. I've drilled hundreds of 3/16 and 1/4 inch holes (for mounting clocks and hooks) and these things do not stop.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Best bits that I've used
customer_reviews.text: I found these bits to be far superior to other bits, including other manufacturers' carbide bits. It made easy work of drilling through brick with a lightweight percussion drill motor...
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn7175

customer_reviews.title: Hammer time
customer_reviews.text: Very decent bits for the money. DeWalt bits are not necessarily the highest quality, but these are more than adequate. The included case pouch thingy keeps them organized with out taking up a ton of space. A lot of drill bit cases are half empty wasted space. This is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Missing 1/2" bit
customer_reviews.text: I just got around to using these and what do you know, the 1/2" bit is missing. There was a 3/8" bit in it's place and a 5/16" bit in the place of the 3/8" bit. So I got two 5/16" bits and no 1/2". What has happened here?
customer_reviews.author: Ride your BIKE!

customer_reviews.title: Worked to drill through concrete
customer_reviews.text: Paired with the Ryobi P214 hammer drill... was able to drill about 15 3 inches deep holes into concrete using the 1/4" bit. Looks like the bit tip still has about half of its life left. So I'm not sure that they are super durable, but they last and work much better than some of the other reviews I read on here where the guy used a single bit for each hole. Should be plenty to complete a small project, and I can't complain as I got them on sale for ten bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bits for concrete drilling
customer_reviews.text: Was having a hard time drilling through some concrete and i picked these up for a pretty fair price. i had some new bits from lowes, cant remember the brand but these were night and day. what took my hours the day before took me 5 min with these.
customer_reviews.author: ashton

customer_reviews.title: Great bits for concrete
customer_reviews.text: I tried several bits for concrete, DEWALT is the best one so far. Together with proper hammer drill it can make your job very simple and easy. I used Bosch hammer drill and DEWALT 15/16 bit to drill 12 holes in concrete for my new gazebo - nice and easy. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nick the photog

customer_reviews.title: Great set to add to my DeWalt collection
customer_reviews.text: Great set to add to my DeWalt collection. I always needed a masonry drill bits I used some of the cheap ones and oh boy they burned on the spot haha. But like always DeWalt have the best quality tools and accessories and I am happy with the quality and the price. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: It went right through cement like it is supposed to. It fit the drill like it is supposed to. It did the job. Only used the smallest bit.
customer_reviews.author: MissT

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I needed these to punch some holes in an old cement slab that I have and they chewed right through it without any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Look good but cheap
customer_reviews.text: They look good but don’t last. Burned up 4 bits trying to drill one hole using the skill hammer drill. That was a piece of junk too. Spend a little more and get higher quality bits.
customer_reviews.author: R. Humbert

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done
customer_reviews.text: After limited use, these masonry bits seem to get the job done. I can't speak into their longevity, but my initial use was satisfying. Between my hammer drill and these bits, I was able to drill through concrete block with ease. Was a little disappointed in the packaging. The yellow material was dry and cracked at the bottom of the 3 largest bits...causing the bits to slide/fall out. I was hoping there would be some type of flap to lift so that I could use this packaging to store the bits when not in use. Bummer. I'll just need to invest in a drill index now. But overall, I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: They've done what I've asked
customer_reviews.text: Came as described and worked well. I bought them to drill through ceramic pots to make drainage holes for planting flowers and the last hole drilled as easy as the first with no chipping or cracking. Good quality items that have stood up to fairly light use.
customer_reviews.author: Sam in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Needed these to replace the cheap drill bits I had that had broken. These are strong and tough. Drilled through brick mortar
customer_reviews.author: m grippin

customer_reviews.title: Use to drill holes in plant pots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drill holes in my plant pots for better drainage and it works perfectly. Did about 10 pots with no issues. Came as described.
customer_reviews.author: Zakk & Steph

customer_reviews.title: Used with a standard drill - went through
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used these on non hammer drills and were able to go through brick and mortar. Likely took longer, but bits fit and seemed to cut a nice hole without chips, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Skredberry

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I used these bits to drill holes in 6 inch concrete for anchors and they worked like a charm. Be careful as the bits get very hot after a while.
customer_reviews.author: outer

customer_reviews.title: Good kit
customer_reviews.text: I used these to punch a hole in some clay pots that weren't draining well. The first pot is 1.75" thick and the other was 1.5". The drill bit turned all kinds of colors from the heat but went through easier than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Don't ask for problems,DeWalt knows their business
customer_reviews.text: Used couple bits on concrete garage wall, cut good, no problem at all, even with my DeWalt drill without hammer capability
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good set of Hammer Drills
customer_reviews.text: It is a great set of masonry hammer drills. The selection is excellent and helps you on the job site. The only negative is the plastic pouch they came in is a piece of garbage, It either needs to be made out of HARD PLASTIC or STEEL.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Garber

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Lasting, Tough!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome drill bits! They’re stronger than the ones I bought at the big box store and speedily make all the holes without me needing to strain my drill. Even after use they’re still nice and sharp. Durable and the price was terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: They work...
customer_reviews.text: Just drilled with the same bit ,50 holes through 1/2" stucco, dryer exhaust fan 6 " flapper vent knock out,very tough stucco on my house...Let it cool off between now and then of course you know that...good home owner bit...
customer_reviews.author: michael gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Oops, I broke one
customer_reviews.text: I was drilling into the concrete1/4 long with minimal pressure and the bit snapped in two. I don't like the packaging because it had holes in the case so I can't reuse it.
customer_reviews.author: Lonchaney111

customer_reviews.title: Lots of muscle, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Fastest delivery of any order I've ever placed on Amazon. This tool is sturdy and has lots of muscle. It's a "Binford"! Nice case, two batteries and a charger. What's not to like about the vendor or the product?
customer_reviews.author: George J. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Bits
customer_reviews.text: This was an add on suggestion from Amazon when I bought a hammer drill. Good call! Saved me time, effort. Got a great set of masonry bits to complete my collection for home repairs and diy projects.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: Short lasting drill bit for concrete work.
customer_reviews.text: I just got my masonry bits and used my 3/16 to drill about a dozen holes in the block wall around my yard to mount motion sensor lights. This bit became dull very quickly.... Very disappointed that it dulled so fast. I deliberately picked DeWalt for its name and was hoping for better quality. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with these Dewalt percussion bits!
customer_reviews.text: I have used three of these bits so far and I am very impressed with how well they hold their edge and their ability to do their job. If these came with a Dewalt tough-case they would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for ceramic
customer_reviews.text: Tried to drill a hole in ceramic tile after bathroom remodeling and started with the smallest of the Dewalt bits. These bits wouldn't do it. Went to my old bosch bits and finished in no time. I bought these thinking I might need new ones, not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Drills work perfect, read the instructions. These are not for an impact drill, these are for a standard drill. Use plenty of water, and I mean plenty to keep the carbide insert very cool while drilling through concrete
customer_reviews.author: 38Super

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Work 1000 times better than the cheap ones made in c....a that I've bought before
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Good quolity.
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty with the bits i had in drilling into concrete block,so I decided to buy better bits.The Dewalt bits changed a hard job to an easy job, I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Nello Papi

customer_reviews.title: These drill bits work great! Put them in my Dewalt drill and it ...
customer_reviews.text: These drill bits work great! Put them in my Dewalt drill and it went through concrete with ease and showed no signs of dulling after heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Bits. Fits 3/8'' drill.
customer_reviews.text: These are great drill bits for concrete. A really nice feature is that the 1/2 inch bit is smaller at the bottom, so that it will fit into your drill that generally maxes out at 3/8''. I used these to drill into concrete steps and they worked great. I drilled several holes and the bits still look new. I used these bits to drill concrete with a standard drill (non-hammer drill). You just need to work your way up to bigger bits and use some muscle behind your drill.
customer_reviews.author: RollAwaytheDew

customer_reviews.title: a good set that will actually drill into rock
customer_reviews.text: Most sets are made for concrete only, these will actually drill into rock. Perhaps not as long as bits dedicated for that purpose but these will see you through for occasional use in rock.
customer_reviews.author: Losten Deforest

customer_reviews.title: Professional bits, works perfectly, used almost all of them. Package is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The item is more than I expected!!! I have done a lot of research on this category and was amazed with this quality. Tried with my Bosch drill and after 3 seconds there was a perfect hole. These bits enter the material like a knife to a good butter. Very satisfied and recommended to others. This is really professional tool!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great drill bits
customer_reviews.text: I have used Dewalt products for years and when I needed a new set of drill bits I ordered these. I was not disappointed they worked very well on a concrete project I worked on with them.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: A Cut Above Just like All DeWalt Products
customer_reviews.text: I used these drill bits to install a railing onto my concrete front porch and they worked well with my" masonry drill". Cut an approximately 3" depth hole 8 times so far and appears to have plenty of life left with the same drill.
customer_reviews.author: maintenance man

customer_reviews.title: Goes thorugh brick and concrete with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them on Amazon because they were double the price at Home Depot. All 7 bits were there, and packaging was easy to open. I've only needed to use the 1/4 inch bit, but it worked fantastically. Went through concrete and brick with no problem, whereas other non-masonry bits were literally melting. It made mounting my motion-sensing lights a breeze. It's worth the money. Note: Drill used was a Dewalt dcd996 hammer drill with hammering ON.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Severe

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Usual DeWalt quality. Very well made and all the useful sizes.
customer_reviews.author: James Braun

customer_reviews.title: Like a knife through butter
customer_reviews.text: Was using an off brand and didn’t know how much easier drilling through cement could be. I bit the bullet and bought the Dewalt bits. Like a knife through butter!
customer_reviews.author: William Klein-pells

customer_reviews.title: Quality bits
customer_reviews.text: These bits are holding up really well have drilled through brick and concrete and have a managed to break any and they seem to be holding up to the sharpness
customer_reviews.author: Robert Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Very nice masonry bit set.
customer_reviews.text: Very good set of masonry bits. Use them often and they work great. Smooth holes with no wobble or chipping. My go to masonry bits. Purchased another set just to have as a backup but haven’t needed them.
customer_reviews.author: David Armon

customer_reviews.title: Great strength for the value
customer_reviews.text: I broke 3 other drill bits before I bought this set and a manager to dull 2 down 2 of these ones pretty well drilling concrete. They are great drill bits over all though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good variety of bit sizes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent variety of drill bit sizes that I have used with my hammer drill. I don't know how to compare the drills with their competitors, but I'm very pleased with this set of bits. I especially am happy that they do not slip in the chuck. Chuck slippage is a real pain with some drill bits! Most of you have likely experienced this annoying problems with some bits. If you haven't, you're very lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Howard R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've chewed up a dozen or so masonry bits putting things up in my block home. Found these, read the other reviews and pulled the trigger. So far, multiple uses on a few bits and no wear on the tips!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: They're ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: One broke the first time I used it. The others don't really go through cement without all the strength you have behind it. I was using a corded drill for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut like butter
customer_reviews.text: I wouldnt say they cut like butta...they havent broke so that's a plus but they arnt any different than other masonry bits I've used
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend using a little water or oil to minimize wear ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well going through porcelain and ceramic tile. I recommend using a little water or oil to minimize wear and prolong life. Seats nicely in the chuck and appear to be of high quality. I expect these to last me a lifetime as these won't be something I use extensively. Nice to have them in the toolbox and know that I can count on them when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Nuzum

customer_reviews.title: Don't last
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for anchoring my safe with a Milwaukee M18 Hammer Drill. The bit I used barely lasted for 4 holes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set of Bits
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go with a new hammer drill for drilling into concrete. Worked well, Nice having both long and short sizes
customer_reviews.author: M. Benedict

customer_reviews.text: One in set was missing. I got a replacement. But It got lost. I got money back. I ordered those again. Will see in few days
customer_reviews.author: milos

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Used these to drill 2 holes through a brick wall to run a new doorbell camera. They worked well and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tj Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Masonry drill bits.
customer_reviews.text: Used to drill into brick so that I could install a ring video doorbell. They did the job and am pleased with their performance.
customer_reviews.author: Red Devil

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done with a lot of effort.
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as a masonry bit but did not drill through brick very well. It did get the job done but took me every bit of an hour to drill (3) holes using the 3/16 bit. Would probably purchase a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Ok for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: For small jobs, thesebirs are fine. But for real concrete drilling, a dedicated SDS hammer drill with bits is much faster and the bits last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kakareko

customer_reviews.title: Bites like a beast
customer_reviews.text: Used these with a hammer drill to make some holes in my garage concrete floor. They did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Used it with my electric hammer drill to drill out some holes in the cement and the drillbit did it's job smoothly without much fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill Bits
customer_reviews.text: These drill bits have been wonderful. I recently purchased a compact drill and used these to drill into brick and mount a TV. They did a great job and I believe that they will be very dependable for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Kucoy71

customer_reviews.title: Tough and Durable Bits!
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer with the US Forest Service and have been renovating some cinderblock restroom/shower buildings. Installing grab bars, light fixtures, etc. and these masonry bits have done the job. They have held their edge as I have used them over and over. Not sure why previous reviewer said they were bad. Carrying case is convenient and it gives you two 1/4" bits that I use for wall anchor holes. I would purchase them again and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Tough drill bit for concrete wall. Much easier work ourdoor house project.
customer_reviews.text: Tough drill and get into my concrete wall so easy compare to my steel tool drill. If the package can have a smaller size but, will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: CHL

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT Masonry Drill Bit Set, Percussion, 7-Piece (DW5207)
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very strong and excellent price. Very fast shipping. I recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Drilled a few holes in 3/4in granite
customer_reviews.text: The bits held up for me. used only a few sizes on granite, took a bit to get through, but they work
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great value set
customer_reviews.text: Using a regular power drill, these bits easily bored into the concrete filling of the top row of my block wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A 1 quality
customer_reviews.text: Cut like a hot knife thru butter when using correctly by starting small and increase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K.

customer_reviews.title: Only got 5-piece
customer_reviews.text: The package I received only has five drill bits. The 3/8'' and 1/2'' are missing. I don't know how this can happen.
customer_reviews.author: Yi Xu

customer_reviews.title: Used and/or missing drill bits?
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. 3 or 4 of the drill bits had been pushed out of the plastic holder, near the bottom, that made holes in the plastic and then we’re re-taped to keep them from falling out. My guess is that they had been used. The half inch bit was totally missing. I didn’t return them only because I wanted to install a new outdoor clock for Mother’s Day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Like drilling through soft wood
customer_reviews.text: I bought these drill bits along with a low cost Neiko 10506A hammer drill to drill holes in my concrete garage floor to mount a vertical air compressor. With the hammer drill, the 3/8" bit made quick work of the concrete - it really felt like I was drilling into soft wood. The last hole felt as easy as the first, so no rapid wear of the bit happened. I haven't used them extensively yet, but my first impression is very positive.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: The bit I used broke while trying to drill a hole in my brick house. Could not get a hole drilled.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Sue

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not as good as others
customer_reviews.text: Not as hard of material as what I'm used to in masonary bits. I expected better life from them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Close, But no Cigar!
customer_reviews.text: Uhhh, something was missing - there was a big hole in the package and one of the bits was missing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly & Cary Reams

customer_reviews.title: Work Fine
customer_reviews.text: Just used them to drill into the masonry fireplace in the basement. Did a great job with very little effort on my part. .
customer_reviews.author: G. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: Drilled 15 holes with the 3/8" bit in about 5 minutes with no issues. These German made bits are the best I've found
customer_reviews.author: Boston Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Carbide tip may not be able withstand older brick (even with an impact drill)
customer_reviews.text: The carbide tip was completely damaged as I tried to bore through the brick to allow me to install an outdoor light fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Pawan Sharma

customer_reviews.title: MONEY saving
customer_reviews.text: Basic tool ,not a high tech tool. It does the work and make the job done. Good price compare to those BIG company. If you are not in a hurry and wait a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: OTMC

customer_reviews.title: Great bits, I've used them to drill through ceramic ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bits, I've used them to drill through ceramic tile, clay pots, cinder block, brick, and cement. Nothing has slowed em down yet. However, I do not use them in a commercial capacity, just a very handy homeowner/carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: Curacao0311

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Used them to drill into hard rock to mount a bracket. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bits!!
customer_reviews.text: These bits work great. The package/sleeve was torn when arrived but not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: ECUPirate

customer_reviews.title: These were the wrong kind, Returned
customer_reviews.text: If there is a place to opt out for returns I cant see it.
customer_reviews.author: krdenney

customer_reviews.title: Great bits
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was ripped when it arrived, so one bit kept falling out. Otherwise, the bits themselves are great!
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Go through hard materials and don’t get dull easily
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using them to drill through brick and concrete just fine, some drill bits have a problem doing that and don’t last very long.
customer_reviews.author: kevin irving

customer_reviews.title: Good value for cost
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as I needed a bit to drill into brick. Product arrived timely and has performed well. Good value for cost vs what local hardware store would have charged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to drill through Hardi Board but wouldn't even start a hole. Returned. Might be ok for other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: nice collection of bits for the price
customer_reviews.text: nice collection of bits for the price; don't expect to drill into steel with these, but great for general-purpose use with wood and plastic and will do softer metals
customer_reviews.author: B. Moret

product_meta.title: DEWALT Masonry Drill Bit Set, Percussion, 7-Piece (DW5207)
product_meta.description:
DEWALT Masonry drill bit set, Percussion, 7-Piece (Dw5207)

AMAZON.COM
An excellent accessory for your cordless hammer drill, this DEWALT seven piece drill bit set provides function and durability for all your rugged drilling needs. Applications include drilling nice, neat holes into masonry, concrete, rock, and artificial stone. Crafted for the average 3/8-inch and 1/2-inch sized chuck, the bits in this set are intended to make holes for mechanical anchors. The set includes the following pieces: 3/16-inch by 3, 1/4-inch by 4, 5/16-inch by 6, 3/8-inch by 6, 1/2-inch by 6 and two 1/4-inch by 6s.
feature_bullets: The product is 7PC MAS Drill Bit Set
The product is manufactured in Germany
Rock carbide tip maximizes carbide surface contact for longer bit life
Four-flute design cleans debris out for fast, efficient drilling
Three flats on shank eliminate bit slipping in chuck
For use with electric or cordless hammerdrills
Ideal for drilling holes in brick, block, concrete, and masonry

specifications.Included Components: DEWALT DW5207 7-Piece Premium Percussion Masonry Drill Bit Set
